virtual void XPrimaryDriver::afterStop (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Be called for closing interfaces. This should not cause an exception.

const XTime &  time_recorded

  • time_recorded usually pass XTime::now()

template<typename tVar>
void XPrimaryDriver::push (  tVar   )  [inline, protected]
 

These are FIFO (fast in fast out) Push raw data to raw record Use signed/unsigned char, short(16bit), and int32_t for integers. IEEE 754 float and double for floting point numbers. Little endian bytes will be stored into thread-local

See also:
rawData().

virtual void XPrimaryDriver::start (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Start up your threads, connect GUI, and activate signals This should not cause an exception.

Implemented in XDCSource, XDMM, XDSO, XFuncSynth, XLevelMeter, XLIA, XMagnetPS, XMonteCarloDriver, XNetworkAnalyzer, XPulser, XSG, XTempControl, and XTestDriver.

virtual void XPrimaryDriver::stop (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Shut down your threads, unconnect GUI, and deactivate signals this may be called even if driver has already stopped. This should not cause an exception.

Implemented in XDCSource, XDMM, XDSO, XFuncSynth, XLevelMeter, XLIA, XMagnetPS, XMonteCarloDriver, XNetworkAnalyzer, XPulser, XSG, XTempControl, and XTestDriver.
